Thesaurus/Controlled Vocabulary Used: Term suggestions and filters use a.o. MeSH and MAG

Ontology/Ontologies Supported: Fully customizable data collection screens; campus, college and department-defined ontologies
Uses elements of FOAF and Dublin Core in RDF; uses Pellet reasoning engine
Automatic Author Disambiguation: No (but can be done in conjunction with software developed at Northwestern University)

Research Networking Tool: PROFILES by Mentis (formerly Collaborative Partnership / Profile System)
Ontology/Ontologies Supported: Dublin Core, Social Media and compatible with VIVO and other popular ontologies

Automatic Author Disambiguation: Yes (Author clustering capabilities used to match authors with papers)
No (but can be done manually by authors)

Research Networking Tool: Elsevier's Pure (now integrated with SciVal Experts)

Automatic Author Disambiguation: No (can be done manually by authors)

Thesaurus/Controlled Vocabulary Used: ProQuest thesaurus, ERA FOR, PQTD, and more, All thesauri are regularly updated.
Ontology/Ontologies Supported: Plans to implement the VIVO ontology

Automatic Author Disambiguation: No (but can be done manually through Google Scholar "My Citations" functionality)
No (Though InCites can accept data from ResearcherID and Converis profiling systems for disambiguation)

Ontology/Ontologies Supported: Uses elements of FOAF and other ontologies
Automatic Author Disambiguation: No (but can be done manually by authors)

Ontology/Ontologies Supported: Fully customizable ontology that maps to VIVO
Automatic Author Disambiguation: Yes (using parsing algorithm on free text)

Thesaurus/Controlled Vocabulary Used: MeSH, others are being developed to go beyond the life and biomedical sciences
Ontology/Ontologies Supported: VIVO RDF ontology with additional Profiles RDF classes and properties
Automatic Author Disambiguation: Yes Harvard Profiles uses an XML-based "disambiguation service" to import Medline publications and uses configurable heuristics in its disambiguation algorithm

Thesaurus/Controlled Vocabulary Used: Scopus taxonomy uses MeSH and general keywords

Automatic Author Disambiguation: No (although authors can build their publication list and manually disambiguate)

Ontology/Ontologies Supported:
VIVO Harvester Extension , URL: https://web.archive.org/web/20180611003528/https://github.com/ieb/symplectic-harvester
Harvard Catalyst's Profiles RNS , URL: https://web.archive.org/web/20120101115517/http://profiles.catalyst.harvard.edu/

Thesaurus/Controlled Vocabulary Used: VIVO uses several thesauri that are available through Semantic Web, including MeSH
